item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by حسین پناهی
item.description: "هنوز از اتاق همینگوی بوی باروت میاد هنوز هم ادکلن مرلین مونرو نیمه تمام مانده و پیرزنان به وقت گذشتن از کف آخرین اتاق مایاکوفسکی دامن خود را جمع می کنند یکی می آید به زور یکی می رود به انتخاب" -- حسین پناهی

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "You cannot find peace by avoiding life." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Ludwig van Beethoven
item.description: "Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy" -- Ludwig van Beethoven

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "I must say a word about fear. It is life's only true opponent. Only fear can defeat life. It is a clever, treacherous adversary, how well I know. It has no decency, respects no law or convention, shows no mercy. It goes for your weakest spot, which it finds with unnerving ease. It begins in your mind, always ... so you must fight hard to express it. You must fight hard to shine the light of words upon it. Because if you don't, if your fear becomes a wordless darkness that you avoid, perhaps even manage to forget, you open yourself to further attacks of fear because you never truly fought the opponent who defeated you." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Adolf Hitler
item.description: "If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!" -- Adolf Hitler

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think" -- Socrates

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "I shall look at you out of the corner of my eye, and you will say nothing. Words are the source of misunderstandings." -from the Fox-" -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well." -- Aristotle

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each." -- Plato

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "When you arise in the morning think of what a privilege it is to be alive, to think, to enjoy, to love ..." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together,but do so with all your heart." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Delnavaa add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment." -- Marcus Aurelius
